body_html:
This PR adds a new loss in core TF, focal_loss, which was described in an unreviewed paper that was released on Arxiv on August 7, two weeks ago.

I believe we should not add to core TF (in near-real time) every new idea that gets pushed to Arxiv. All code in core TF needs to be maintained in the long-term: adding new code has a cost, which gets integrated over time. Until it is demonstrated that a given feature is useful, we should not add it to core TF.

This PR adds a new loss in core TF, focal_loss, which was described in an unreviewed paper that was released on Arxiv on August 7, two weeks ago.
I believe we should not add to core TF (in near-real time) every new idea that gets pushed to Arxiv. All code in core TF needs to be maintained in the long-term: adding new code has a cost, which gets integrated over time. Until it is demonstrated that a given feature is useful, we should not add it to core TF.
body:
This PR adds a new loss in core TF, `focal_loss`, which was described in an unreviewed paper that was released on Arxiv on August 7, two weeks ago.

I believe we should not add to core TF (in near-real time) every new idea that gets pushed to Arxiv. All code in core TF needs to be maintained in the long-term: adding new code has a cost, which gets integrated over time. Until it is demonstrated that a given feature is useful, we should not add it to core TF.
